title: Bi-Weekly Music Discussion Thread
selftext:
What is r/India listening to? Share and discuss songs, playlists, artists, or anything music-related here!

If you're a musician yourself, please share your work so we can all hear what up-and-coming musicians are doing these days.

Don't just mention stuff, link it! Links that are official and provided by the artists themselves are preferred.

**Music Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Music+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/06d0xwq1x8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=4195dbb767ebd70a3209ea46a4497062e788c176
comments:
My three recos for the thread:  
- Radiohead by Alix Page. Delicate acoustic performance.  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PrDqxOJgLG4  
- Raglan by Grace Cummings. Powerful voice.  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VTv3Zfy2C8I  
- The Last Goodbye by ODESZA. Clubbers might like this.  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GpuUOl6ddVI&t=18s
Can someone recommend me the best of Mac Miller? I've only recently started listening to him.

Okay, this is my time to shine. His early stuff is when he was a bit immature (for lack of a better word) and rapping about partying and high school shenanigans, for that listen to kids and Best Day Ever. Nikes On My Feet is still a constant jam for me and an all time classic imo. 

Watching Movies w the sound off and Faces was at a time when his substance use (abuse) was really taking its toll and you can hear that lyrically and in the music in those albums. Check out the star room, I'm not real, REMember, avian, diablo, here we go, wedding, happy birthday, from these two. 

I think swimming is his best album but that's prolly cos it's the first one i heard. And the entire album is really good, no skips. Jet Fuel is probably my fav mac miller song of all time. 

Have fun man
Thanks, will check these out. Cheers.

I divided my life into different tastes in music and zip & archive folders when I feel the arc came to an end.

It almost feels like a diary.
